DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate effect repeat oral dose ASP1941 electrocardiogram ( ECG ) measurement .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Effect ASP1941 Cardiac Repolarization Healthy Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects randomize four treatment sequence twenty subject . Subjects treatment sequence participate total four treatment period ( A , B , C , D ) separate washout period least 7 day completion prior period ( Day 8 ) clinical check-in ( Day -1 ) next study period . For Period 1 , subject admit clinical research unit Day -2 . For subsequent study period , subject admit clinical research unit Day -1 . Subjects discharge unit completing procedure Day 8 period . Subjects receive follow-up telephone call 7-10 day last clinic day ( Period 4\Early Discontinuation [ ED ] ) .
DOC.criteria: The subject weigh least 45 kg , body mass index ( BMI ) 18 32 kg/m2 If female , subject must least two year postmenopausal , surgically sterile practice effective birth control , pregnant lactate The male female subject agree practice highly effective birth control 30 day post last study drug dose The subject highly likely comply protocoldefined procedure complete study The subject history unexplained syncope , cardiac arrest , unexplained cardiac arrhythmia torsade de pointes , structural heart disease , family history Long QT syndrome ( suggest sudden death due cardiac cause young age close relative ) The subject anticipate inability abstain alcohol , caffeine use , grapefruit grapefruit juice 72 hour prior dose throughout duration study The subject use tobaccocontaining product nicotine nicotinecontaining product within past six month The subject unable tolerate control , quiet study conduct environment , include avoidance specify time ( e.g. , major disease malignancy ( exclude nonmelanoma skin cancer ) The subject history clinically significant allergic condition anaphylactic reaction The subject condition possibly affect drug absorption The subject history consume 14 unit alcoholic beverage per week within 6 month prior screen history alcoholism drug/chemical/substance abuse within past 2 year The subject has/had febrile illness immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) antibody The subject positive test hepatitis C antibody , positive hepatitis B antigen ( HBsAg ) The subject use prescription nonprescription drug within 14 day 5half life ( whichever longer ) complementary alternative medicine ( CAM ) within 28 day prior Day 2 Period 1 ( exclude oral contraceptive , hormone replacement therapy [ HRT ] , acetaminophen ) The subject receive experimental agent within 30 day 10 halflives , whichever longer , prior study drug administration The subject participate another clinical trial participate another dose group current trial
